description:
As the admin user
I want to choose the Tool Definition for the system
So that I can use work with it
name: Choosing Tool Definition

steps.name: the admin user is on Tool Builder admin page
a tool definition called Test Tool exists
the user selects Test Tool as default tool def
she goes to the Tool Instances Navigation Page
the name of the choosen tool definition is Test Tool

description:
As a user
I want to be able to navigate through the steps in a given tool instance
So that the step of each tool instance is saved
name: Navigate through Steps

steps.name: the user is on Tool Instances Navigation Page
she logs in the system as testUser@sharklasers.com with password testPasswd

elements.name: Pull up one tool instance from step 1 to 2

steps.name: the user creates a tool instance called Other Tool Instance
she selects the tool instance Other Tool Instance
she chooses to step forward
she returns to the Tool Instances Navigation Page
the tool instance called Other Tool Instance is on step 2
the user is on Tool Instances Navigation Page
she logs in the system as testUser@sharklasers.com with password testPasswd

elements.name: Pull up one tool instance from step 2 to 4

steps.name: a tool instance called Other Tool Instance exists
the tool instance called Other Tool Instance is on step 2
the user selects the tool instance Other Tool Instance
she chooses to step forward
she chooses to step forward
she returns to the Tool Instances Navigation Page
the tool instance called Other Tool Instance is on step 4
the user is on Tool Instances Navigation Page
she logs in the system as testUser@sharklasers.com with password testPasswd

elements.name: Try to pull up one tool instance above step 5

steps.name: a tool instance called Other Tool Instance exists
the tool instance called Other Tool Instance is on step 4
the user selects the tool instance Other Tool Instance
she chooses to step forward
she chooses to step forward
she chooses to step forward
she chooses to step forward
she returns to the Tool Instances Navigation Page
the tool instance called Other Tool Instance is on step 5
the user selects the tool instance Other Tool Instance
she deletes the current tool instance

description:
As the admin user
I want to manage new Tool Definitions in the system
So that I can choose them as the system Tool Definition
name: Tool Definition Management

steps.name: the admin user is on Tool Builder admin page
she chooses to create a new tool definition
she provides the tool definition name as My New Tool Type
she adds a step of type mock for step 1
she adds a step of type mock for step 2
she adds a step of type mock for step 3
she returns to the Tool Definition admin page
a tool definition called My New Tool Type exists
the user selects My New Tool Type as default tool def
the user is on Tool Instances Navigation Page
a tool definition called My New Tool Type exists
the user creates a tool instance called My New Def Tool Instance
she selects the tool instance My New Def Tool Instance
she chooses to step forward
she chooses to step forward
she chooses to step forward
she chooses to step forward
she returns to the Tool Instances Navigation Page
the tool instance called Other Tool Instance is on step 3
the admin user is on Tool Builder admin page
a tool definition called My New Tool Type exists
she chooses to create a new tool definition
she provides the tool definition name as My New Tool Type
an error message with text "Existing Tool Definition" is shown

elements.name: Try to create an existing Tool Definition and change the name

steps.name: the admin user is on Tool Builder admin page
a tool definition called My New Tool Type exists
she chooses to create a new tool definition
she provides the tool definition name as My New Tool Type
an error message with text "Existing Tool Definition" is shown
she provides the tool definition name as My New Tool Type 2
she adds a step of type mock for step 1
she adds a step of type mock for step 2
she returns to the Tool Definition admin page
a tool definition called My New Tool Type 2 exists
the admin user is on Tool Builder admin page
a tool definition called My New Tool Type 2 exists
the user chooses to edit the tool definition called My New Tool Type 2
she adds a step of type mock for step 3
she moves the step 2 to step 3
she returns to the Tool Definition admin page
a tool definition called My New Tool Type 2 exists
the admin user is on Tool Builder admin page
a tool definition called My New Tool Type 2 exists
the user chooses to edit the tool definition called My New Tool Type 2
she selects to delete the current tool Definition
a tool definition called My New Tool Type 2 does not exist

elements.name: Try to delete an existing Tool Definition with tool instances associated

steps.name: the admin user is on Tool Builder admin page
a tool definition called My New Tool Type exists
the user chooses to edit the tool definition called My New Tool Type
she selects to delete the current tool Definition
an error message with text "This Tool Definition has associated tool instances, please delete the tool instances before deleting this tool definition" is shown

arguments.val: This Tool Definition has associated tool instances, please delete the tool instances before deleting this tool definition

steps.name: the user cancel the current tool definition edition

elements.name: Try to edit an existing Tool Definition with tool instances associated

steps.name: the admin user is on Tool Builder admin page
a tool definition called My New Tool Type exists
the user chooses to edit the tool definition called My New Tool Type
the user moves the step 2 to step 3
an error message with text "This Tool Definition has associated tool instances, please delete the tool instances before editing this tool definition" is shown

arguments.val: This Tool Definition has associated tool instances, please delete the tool instances before editing this tool definition

steps.name: the user cancel the current tool definition edition

elements.name: Delete associated tool instances and to delete an existing Tool Definition selected as default

steps.name: the user is on Tool Instances Navigation Page

result.error_message:
java.lang.AssertionError
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:86)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)

	at org.lrc.liferay.toolbuilder.tests.functional.steps.ToolInstancesNavigationSteps.existingToolInstance(ToolInstancesNavigationSteps.java:71)
	at ✽.And a tool instance called My New Def Tool Instance exists(NewToolDef.feature:82)

steps.name: a tool instance called My New Def Tool Instance exists
the user selects the tool instance My New Instance 2
she deletes the current tool instance
the admin user goes to Tool Builder admin page
she chooses to edit the tool definition called My New Tool Type
she selects to delete the current tool Definition
an error message with text "This Tool Definition is selected as default, please choose other tool definition as default before deleting this one" is shown

arguments.val: This Tool Definition is selected as default, please choose other tool definition as default before deleting this one

steps.name: the user cancel the current tool definition edition
the user selects My New Tool Type as default tool def
she chooses to edit the tool definition called My New Tool Type
she selects to delete the current tool Definition
a tool definition called My New Tool Type does not exist

description:
As a user
I want to be able to create new Tool Instance in the system
So that I can work with that Tool Instance
name: Tool Instance Creation

steps.name: the user is on Tool Instances Navigation Page
she logs in the system as testUser@sharklasers.com with password testPasswd
she chooses to create a new tool instance
she provides the tool instance name as My New Instance
she creates the tool instance
she returns to the Tool Instances Navigation Page
a tool instance called My New Instance exists

elements.name: Create a new existing Tool Instance

steps.name: the user is on Tool Instances Navigation Page
